sn35.121:2.1: 12 The World and the Kinds of Sensual Stimulation
sn35.121:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī, in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn35.121:4.2: Then as he was in private solitude this thought came to his mind:
sn35.121:4.3: “The qualities that ripen in freedom have ripened in Rāhula.
sn35.121:4.4: Why don’t I lead him further to the end of defilements?”
sn35.121:4.5: Then the Buddha got dressed in the morning and, taking his bowl and robes, walked in Sāvatthī for alms. After the meal, when he had returned from alms-round, he addressed Venerable Rāhula:
sn35.121:4.7: Let’s go to the Blind Man’s Wood for the day’s meditation.”
sn35.121:4.8: “Yes, sir,” replied Rāhula. Taking his sitting cloth he followed behind the Buddha.
sn35.121:5.1: Now at that time many thousands of gods followed the Buddha, thinking:
sn35.121:5.2: “Today the Buddha will lead Rāhula further to the end of defilements!”
sn35.121:5.3: Then the Buddha plunged deep into the Blind Man’s Wood and sat at the root of a tree on the indicated seat.
sn35.121:5.4: Rāhula bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.
sn35.121:6.1: “What do you think, Rāhula? Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
sn35.121:8.1: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn35.121:10.1: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn35.121:10.2: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn35.121:18.1: “Anything included in feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”

sn35.121:54.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact. And they become disillusioned with anything included in feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness that arises conditioned by eye contact. …
sn35.121:54.2: They become disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.121:55.1: mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and mind contact. And they become disillusioned with anything included in feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness that arises conditioned by mind contact.
sn35.121:55.4: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn35.121:55.5: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
sn35.121:56.1: This is what the Buddha said.
sn35.121:56.2: Uplifted, Venerable Rāhula approved of what the Buddha said.
sn35.121:56.3: And while this discourse was being spoken, Rāhula’s mind was freed from defilements without grasping.
sn35.121:56.4: And the spotless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in those thousand gods:
sn35.121:56.5: “Everything that has a beginning has an end.”
